summary: Caryl M Emanuel was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Her name appears on multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to February 1979. These documents detail her position and salary within the committee. The consistent appearance of her name across these reports indicates her sustained involvement with the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Caryl M Emanuel's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, contributing to the administrative and operational functions of the committee during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of her role is not detailed in the provided summaries, her presence on payroll and certification reports confirms her involvement in the HSCA's activities.
